At the moment before the collision, block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a speed of <math alttext="v sub 0 " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>v</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. After the collision, block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> travels such that it lands at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Consider the scenario in which block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is released from rest at a height <math alttext="capital H sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is lower than <math alttext="capital H sub 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> but higher than <math alttext="lowercase h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true about the horizontal distance traveled by block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as a projectile in the two scenarios? Assume the collision in both scenarios is elastic.

choices.label: The horizontal distance will be greater for block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is released from height <math alttext="capital H sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The horizontal distance will be greater for block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is released from height <math alttext="capital H sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The horizontal distance will be the same for block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in both scenarios.

The answer cannot be determined without knowing the exact height of <math alttext="capital H sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="capital H sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The horizontal distance will be greater for block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is released from height <math alttext="capital H sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
